node.title: Queensland 'charging towards' 90pc first dose against COVID-19 as state records no new cases
node.alt: Queensland Health Minister Yvette D'Ath stand in front of lectern at race track.
node.description: Queensland is "charging towards" having 90 per cent of its population aged 16 years and over having received a first COVID-19 vaccination dose, the state's Acting Chief Health Officer says.
node.content:
["Queensland is \"charging towards\" having 90 per cent of its population aged 16 years and over having received\u00a0a\u00a0first COVID-19 vaccination dose, the state's Acting Chief Health Officer says.", "It comes as the state records another day of zero new cases, and 23,383 vaccinations at\u00a0Queensland Health facilities\u00a0in the past 24 hours.", "\"That is incredible for a Saturday,\" Health Minister Yvette D'Ath said.", "Queensland is just about to reach\u00a0its first major COVID-19 vaccine milestone of 70 per cent of Queenslanders aged 16 years and over being fully vaccinated, meaning border restrictions will be eased for those fully inoculated.", "The state was initially expected to hit the milestone on November 19, but it now looks to hit it as\u00a0early as Sunday afternoon.\u00a0", "Based on the most recent figures, 81.7\u00a0per cent of Queenslanders aged 16 years or older have received one dose\u00a0of a COVID-19 vaccine and 69.9\u00a0per cent are now fully vaccinated.", "\"We will get 70 per cent tomorrow,\" Acting Chief Health Officer Peter Aitken said.", "\"But what I'm actually really excited about is the movement towards beyond 80 per cent, towards 90 per cent.", "\"With three days of 17,000 and one day of 23,000 [vaccinations], we are now charging towards 90 per cent first dose.", "\"If we can get 90 per cent first dose, we know we can get 90 per cent second dose.\"", "Ms D'Ath thanked Queenslanders for getting vaccinated.", "\"Don't delay that second vaccination.\u00a0Come out as soon as you're due,\" she said.", "\"The fact that we're doing so well\u00a0\u2014\u00a0we're already passed 80 per cent first doses \u2014\u00a0we can definitely get to that 90 per cent, and we can definitely get to that 90 per cent first dose before Christmas, if Queenslanders keep coming out.\"", "Ms D'Ath said the Premier would provide more details about the state's changing border restrictions at tomorrow's press conference.", "\"When we can announce that we have hit 70 per cent double dose [tomorrow], there will be a process and a lead-in time so that the Queensland Police Service and our enforcement officers can make sure that everything is in place,\" Ms D'Ath said.", "\"All that will start happening over the next couple of days.\"", "Ms D'Ath said the updated border pass system would not go live for another 24 hours but urged people wanting to return from COVID-19 hotspots to \"start planning now\".", "\"The most important thing is looking at the criteria to see If they are eligible to fly into Queensland and to home quarantine,\" she said.", "
Testing numbers drop on Gold Coast
", "Meanwhile, Dr Aitken said testing numbers had dropped off on the Gold Coast where\u00a0contact tracers continued to investigate\u00a0the source of two local infections that emerged last week.", "\"We do need all people at [the] Gold Coast, if you've got symptoms, to come forward and get tested,\" Dr Aitken said.", "\"We need to keep testing those people that may have been exposed in the community and find any cases.\""]
